title_full: SAAS01-BP01 Create tenant-aware operational dashboards with health views by tenant and tier
title: Create tenant-aware operational dashboards with health views by tenant and tier
description: Build a robust multi-tenant operational experience that introduces granular views of health and activity needed in a SaaS environment. Create dashboards that include views of health presented through the lens of tenants and tenant tiers. Surface tenant activity as a first-class construct showing health indicators for the most active tenants and data on tenant resource consumption. Operations teams should have the ability to see health and activity of individual tenants and drill into operational data for specific tenants or tiers.

title_full: SAAS01-BP02 Inject tenant context into logs, metrics, and operational data
title: Inject tenant context into logs, metrics, and operational data
description: Ensure tenant context (tenant identifier and tier) is injected into your system's log data and metrics. Creating operational views relies on having access to operational data that includes tenant and tiering context. Give careful consideration to how and where you can inject tenant context into the various mechanisms used to record health and activity events. This enables operations teams to effectively analyze and respond to continually shifting workloads of a SaaS environment.

title_full: SAAS01-BP03 Surface views of tenant consumption across microservices
title: Surface views of tenant consumption across microservices
description: Provide views of consumption that illustrate how tenants are consuming the various microservices of your application. This data allows operations to understand how tenants are consuming different services and determine if a particular tenant or tier might be saturating a particular microservice. View consumption of AWS resources on a tenant-by-tenant basis to see how particular tenants are exercising specific services.

title_full: SAAS01-BP04 Implement automated frictionless tenant onboarding
title: Implement automated frictionless tenant onboarding
description: Create an architecture that promotes a frictionless, repeatable onboarding process through orchestration of shared services that configure and provision all resources needed to introduce a new tenant. The onboarding process should include: calling the registration service, creating a new admin user in the identity provider (like Amazon Cognito), creating tenant attributes via tenant management service, establishing billing integration, and provisioning any dedicated tenant resources. Automated onboarding applies to both B2C and B2B SaaS environments.

title_full: SAAS01-BP05 Separate tenant management from user management services
title: Separate tenant management from user management services
description: Maintain tenant as a distinct service separate from user management. The tenant management service provides a centralized way to manage the state and attributes of a tenant completely separate from the users associated with that tenant. A tenant's tier, status, or configuration options would be controlled by the tenant management service. This separation is essential to SaaS environments for proper multi-tenant architecture.

title_full: SAAS01-BP06 Use feature flags for tenant-specific customizations instead of code forks
title: Use feature flags for tenant-specific customizations instead of code forks
description: Support tenant-specific customization requirements through feature flags rather than creating forked versions of your product. Feature flags allow multiple paths of execution in a common code base with flags that enable or disable capabilities at runtime. Each feature flag correlates to a tenant configuration option evaluated at runtime. This approach maintains a unified customer management, operations, support, and deployment experience while meeting occasional one-off needs. Apply feature flags with caution to avoid creating an unmanageable maze of options.

title_full: SAAS01-BP07 Capture and analyze tenant activity and consumption metrics
title: Capture and analyze tenant activity and consumption metrics
description: Instrument and publish a rich collection of tenant metrics from your application that accurately capture the activity and consumption patterns of tenants. SaaS metrics go beyond fundamental infrastructure consumption (CPU, memory) to identify specific operational usage patterns fundamental to understanding multi-tenant loads. Identify key points in your application where you'll capture and publish these metrics. Use data warehouse and business intelligence tools for ingestion, aggregation, and surfacing of this data.

title_full: SAAS01-BP08 Build operational views tailored to your application architecture
title: Build operational views tailored to your application architecture
description: Design operational views based on your application's design and architecture. Think about the operational views that will enable operations teams to effectively monitor tenant trends and build the instrumentation into your environments from the outset. Adding multi-tenant concepts into your application later in the development process is more challenging and will likely undermine both development and operational experiences.
